data.title: Super friendly
data.text:
Great air conditioning. Nice and friendly barstaff. Good experience. Good recomendations on local beer brews. Will
Come back and visit soon

data.title: Good beer and ambiance but took forever to get our food.
data.text:
We stopped by for a quick bite and a beer.  The food was really good. I really liked their tacos. 
When we went it was not that busy, so it was hard to understand why they took so long to get our food. 

Overall I would go back for drinks and to hang out.

data.title: Quick service with a smile!
data.text: Stopped in one afternoon for a drink and a small bite.  The service was very quick and being a hot day they were very quick to bring water refills.  The hummus appetizer was very tasty.

data.title: Really cool spot to chill
data.text: Gringo Star is a decent spot to stop in for some drinks.  Never ate any food, so can't comment on their menu, but the bartenders were goregous and friendly to speak with.  Drinks were made promptly, even when small crowd had gathered, and there were only two bartenders working.  In a central spot on Mill Ave, with access to all points on the street.  They have a cool retro gaming/aracade thing going on as well, so makes the night funnier when drinking with friends.

data.title: good drinks
data.text: Fun place to stop in and have a drink. I loved the fact that they had Deep Eddy's vodka. Good stuff. Tv's to watch and good place to people watch.

data.title: Similar to eating out of a dumpster... HIGHLY Disappointing (fight almost broke out)
data.text:
Dumpster food = (no waitress service, bad customer service, cold food, and you may see a fight nearby)  AKA just go eat at Gringo Star

So i don't really know where to start... we had such high expectations for this place but it failed on all occasions!  WE get there and the 2 game systems are in use and never released for anyone else to play Mario kart!  

Then i get ready to order some TOTROS (tater tot nachos) from the menu and they no longer exist.... but there are regular nachos (not on the menu)  I ask if its possible to do the nachos and add tater tots to them .... and apparently that is an impossible task!   SO i ask if i can get tater tots with just cheese.. ALSO SHOT down (also on the menu)  they weren't out of tater tots as someone else got a side item with tater tots at our table unbeknownst to my tater tot anguish.   

My nachos arrive obviously tater tot free... and upon my first bite i quickly learn that the Guacamole that is on my mystery nachos have a crazy kick to them.... enter GHOST PEPPERS!  now i like hot stuff so no big deal, but you know what else i like hot... my food itself... the chips were hard, meat was cold, and cheese wasn't even melted????? The manager/ owner guy comes over and asks how are things to which the other person with nachos replies (what is in this guac?) and the says ohhh you like that huh??? my mama sita in the kitchen threw in some ghost peppers... nice right!)

Then while we are eating two guys get up from the bar and start swinging at each other/ pushing etc... the manager or owner breaks it up and lets them stay seated at the bar and asks them to fill out an "incident form"  maybe he should have just told them to "hug it out"   Our waitress was USELESS when anyone needed literally anything they had to get up and go to the bar and ask for help need i mind you that it wasn't busy and there were 3+ waitresses plus 2 at the bar and the manager (only they were talking to each other not the customers)

Needless to say of the 9 of us there the only truly satisfied was the person that didn't eat lunch and was so hungry he could have eaten his own fingers and been pleased.

Go find some food in a dumpster before you eat here... at least you will get what you expect... and it will be about the same quality, cold food, no service, and if you are in the right spot you might can even watch a game through a bar window or something and have a better view than we did of a tv.)

data.title: Good wings and fun place
data.text: Gringo Star is a place for decent beer and pretty good wings. It's a bar with bar food, so understand that when you go. It's open and noisy with college kids there. Its fun!

data.title: Great Happy Hour!
data.text: We only had drinks, so I can't speak to the food.  We went for Happy Hour and it was not very busy.  We got great service and the drinks were cold.  Great deals during happy hour!

data.title: Best dancing!
data.text: The drinks here are ridiculously expensive and small.  Go drink somewhere else before coming here to dance.  however the place is usually always packed and it is fun!

data.title: Much better than you would think, looking at it from outside.
data.text:
You'd think this was a cheap imitation dive bar, but it's so much more.
My friend and I went it for a beer and something small. We had a wonderful taste treat. 
They have a unique selection of eats that will please any one wanting something different. 
I had the Cubano Sandwich. It was good, but then turned Great after they brought the fried pickles they forgot.
Try something different here. You'll be happy.

data.title: nice little spot on the corner of Mill and 5th
data.text: Popped in for some local beer, but was met with the same Four Peaks beers I'd already experienced the night before elsewhere.  Music was a little loud, but a very nice mix (used Pandora a couple of times).  Enjoyed a beer while watching some baseball on the many TV's.  Lots of seating/space, and there is even a little patio that holds 11 people.  Wait staff was very polite.  Young and old hanging out together.

data.title: Nice place to hang out with friends
data.text: This was really a nice place to hang out.  They have games and lots and lots of TVs.  We went there to watch the Maywether fight.  The staff was really nice, the TVs were great.  The fight was a big disappointment though! LOL

data.title: Great atmosphere. Cold beer. Below-average food.
data.text:
A few co-workers and I landed here one night in August, 2014.

The beer selection was huge. The waiter and bartender were pleasant and we were served quickly. 

The food was sorely disappointing. My bacon-wrapped hot dog came on a baguette and had one piece of bacon on it. The bun was so huge it overpowered the hot dog and lonely piece of bacon.

The "house chips" were fried so hard they were charred. The kitchen tried to cover the flavor by drowning them in kosher salt. I ate one and sent them back for an order of fries. 

Other people said the food was "good" and "OK", but no one raved.

The arcade games and skee-ball were a hit with the team.

This is a neat bar/club, but don't go expecting a decent meal.
